member.summary: A versatile collection class that can be easily extended.
member.typeparam: The object type that the collection will contain.
member.remarks: Note to implementors: Override the , , , and methods to define custom behavior to execute when the collection is modified. If you need to raise events when the collection is modified, you should extend from instead.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Core.ISettingsDeepCloneable
member.summary: The ISettingsDeepCloneable interface allows classes to implement an extensible deep cloning pattern whereby each level in the inheritance hierarchy is responsible for cloning only those members that are specific to that level. Generally, this means a sub-class would override to clone only those fields and properties that are defined in that sub-class and would call the base class's implementation of to clone fields and properties inherited from the base class. Concrete classes at each level of the inheritance hierarchy must override to correctly instantiate a new instance of that class.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Core.ISettingsDeepCloneable.CreateInstance
member.summary: Creates an instance of the current object's which can then be populated with the cloned fields and properties of the current object using the method.
member.returns: An instance of the current object's .
member.remarks: Note to implementors: Generally, this method should do nothing more than construct a new instance of the current object's but not fill in any of the fields or properties; setting the fields and properties is the responsibility of the method.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Core.ISettingsDeepCloneable.CloneSettings(System.Object)
member.summary: Deep clones the fields and properties of the current object and assigns them to the given object.
member.remarks: A note to implementors: Generally, the first call in a sub-class's implementation of this method should be to the base class's implementation of this method to have the base class fill in any fields or properties that are inherited from that class.

member.returns: A representation of in the target format.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Core.ColorStringConverter.Convert(System.Drawing.Color,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the given to a string. If the color is represented by a well-known color name, and is false then the string returned is the color name (see ). Otherwise, the string returned is the hex value of the color, prefixed with a "#" character.
member.param: The input object in the original format.
if set to true the string returned will be a hex value even if it is converted from a well-known color name.
member.returns: A representation of in the target format.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Core.ColorStringConverter.Convert(System.Drawing.Color,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the given to a string. If the color is represented by a well-known color name, and is false then the string returned is the color name (see ). Otherwise, the string returned is the hex value of the color, prefixed with a "#" character.
member.param: The input object in the original format.
if set to true the string returned will be a hex value even if it is converted from a well-known color name.
if set to true the string will be a hex value, and it will include the alpha component as the first two characters in the hex number.
member.returns: A representation of in the target format.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Core.Extensions.HttpExtensions.GetUriHost(System.Web.HttpRequest,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the host from the current request, unless explicitly specified via application settings (web.config) variables. A "host" without any trailing port information implies the default port for the service requested; otherwise the host will contain a domain name or IP address followed by a ":" and the port.
member.param: If set to true return the internal host; otherwise the external host is returned.
member.returns: The host, or null if the host can not be determined.
member.remarks: This method uses server variables; thus, it respects port forwarding, url rewriting or reverse proxy environments which may have been configured. The internal host and external host will be set to the values provided in the application variables "InternalHost" and "ExternalHost" respectively if explicitly defined in the web.config.
member.exception: If is null.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Core.Extensions.HttpExtensions.GetUriHost(System.Web.HttpRequestBase,System.Boolean)

member.remarks: This method uses server variables; thus, it respects port forwarding, url rewriting or reverse proxy environments which may have been configured. member.exception: If is null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage transparency for the component when overlaid on components.
member.remarks: This is a value between 0 (no transparency, the default) and 100 (completely transparent, i.e., no visibility). Setting a value above 0 causes the image to be partially transparent, so that the map resource underneath the current resource is partially visible across the map. If only one resource occurs in the map, this property should not be set above the default value of zero (0).

member.name: T:Geocortex.Core.Pipelining.Common.StrandBasedTransform`1
member.summary: Implements a filter that transforms a message strand into a new message strand.
member.remarks:
This pipeline filter is usually used fro aggregation or state based transformation. The transform is given a sub-sequence of messages (message strand) and will output a new message strand.
NOTE: During evaluation, the TryApplyTo method MUST NOT inspect the given strand, but it may, however, apply operators.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Core.Pipelining.HttpRouter.HttpChunkedStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: If the stream does not support reading.
If buffer is null.
If offset is less that zero or greater than the length of the buffer.
If the stream has already been disposed.
If the instance is in a faulted state.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.
member.exception: Always throws.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the length of the current stream.

member.exception: Always throws.

The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: If the stream does not support reading.
If buffer is null.
If offset is less than zero or greater than the length of the buffer.
If the stream has already been disposed.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Core.ILogicalEqualityComparable
member.summary: Allows an object to define how to determine whether it is logically equal to other objects of the same type.
member.remarks: It can be preferable to implement this interface rather than overriding Object.Equals since Object.Equals carries with it a number of requirements and assumptions that must be met in order to ensure proper operation of objects of a given type within a . Generally speaking, the advantage of implementing this interface is that it allows one to determine the logical (in)equality of two objects without requiring that those objects are immutable.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Core.ILogicalEqualityComparable.LogicalEquals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the given object is logically equal to the current object. Two objects are logically equal if they refer to the same object instance or they are otherwise equivalent to each other.
member.param: The object to compare with the current object.
member.returns: true if the specified object is logically equal to the current object; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Called when appending headers to an outgoing web request is required.

Contains protocol headers associated with the web request.
member.remarks: This method is an implementation of . You typically do not have to override this method. Override instead.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Core.Serialization.UriSerializationSurrogate
member.summary: It turns out that .NET trashes the original string in a URI when serializing it. It looks like it serializes the results of the ToString() method, and so the scheme becomes lower case. This surrogate preserves the original string.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Core.Utilities.BlackList
member.summary: A container for singleton BlackLists.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Core.Utilities.BlackList.Https
member.summary: Gets the HTTPS black list singleton - these are URLs that have failed to be supported over SSL. This allows us to avoid trying to make requests to these URLs when we're pretty sure it's going to fail. This saves time because the SSL handshake can be very slow if servers don't support it.

member.summary: Returns the value of the specified string resource.
member.param: The name of the resource to retrieve.

member.summary: Returns the value of the string resource localized for the specified culture.
member.param: The name of the resource to get.
An object that represents the culture for which the resource is localized.
member.returns: The value of the resource localized for the specified culture, or null if cannot be found in a resource set.

member.name: M:Geocortex.LanguagePackResourceManager.GetObject(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of the specified non-string resource.
member.param: The name of the resource to get.
member.returns: The value of the resource localized for the caller's current culture settings. If an appropriate resource set exists but cannot be found, the method returns null.

member.name: M:Geocortex.LanguagePackResourceManager.GetObject(System.String,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified non-string resource localized for the specified culture.
member.param: The name of the resource to get.

The culture for which the resource is localized. If the resource is not localized for this culture, the resource manager uses fallback rules to locate an appropriate resource.If this value is null, the object is obtained using the culture's property.
member.returns: The value of the resource, localized for the specified culture. If an appropriate resource set exists but cannot be found, the method returns null.
